This change will affect both the Weekly Overview section and the Current Shifts table where day names are displayed. The abbreviated format will help prevent text wrapping issues while maintaining clarity in the date display.

```diff

+ import React, { useState } from 'react';
+ import { Link } from 'react-router-dom';
+ import { Eye, EyeOff, Mail, Lock, Github, Chrome } from 'lucide-react';
+ import { Button } from '../components/ui/button';
+ import { Input } from '../components/ui/input';
+ import { Label } from '../components/ui/label';
+ import { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '../components/ui/card';
+ import { Separator } from '../components/ui/separator';
+ import logo from '../assets/logo.png';
+ 
+ export const Login: React.FC = () => {
+   const [showPassword, setShowPassword] = useState(false);
+   const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
+     email: '',
+     password: '',
+   });
+   const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(false);
+ 
+   const handleInputChange = (field: string, value: string) => {
+     setFormData((prev) => ({
+       ...prev,
+       [field]: value,
+     }));
+   };
+ 
+   const handleSubmit = async (e: React.FormEvent) => {
+     e.preventDefault();
+     setIsLoading(true);
+     
+     // Simulate login process
+     setTimeout(() => {
+       setIsLoading(false);
+       // In a real app, this would handle authentication
+       console.log('Login attempt:', formData);
+       // Redirect to dashboard or handle login success
+       window.location.href = '/';
+     }, 1500);
+   };
+ 
+   const handleSocialLogin = (provider: string) => {
+     console.log(`Login with ${provider}`);
+     // In a real app, this would handle social authentication
+   };
+ 
+   return (
+     <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-50 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
+       <div className="w-full max-w-md">
+         {/* Logo Section */}
+         <div className="text-center mb-8">

+             src={logo} 
+             alt="Shiftly Logo" 
+             className="h-16 w-32 object-cover mx-auto mb-4"
+           />
+           <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold text-gray-900">Welcome back</h1>
+           <p className="text-gray-600 mt-2">Sign in to your account to continue</p>
+         </div>

+             </CardDescription>
+           </CardHeader>
+           <CardContent className="space-y-4">

+             <div className="grid grid-cols-2 gap-4">
+               <Button
+                 variant="outline"
+                 onClick={() => handleSocialLogin('Google')}
+                 className="w-full"
+               >
+                 <Chrome className="h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
+                 Google
+               </Button>
+               <Button
+                 variant="outline"
+                 onClick={() => handleSocialLogin('GitHub')}
+                 className="w-full"
+               >
+                 <Github className="h-4 w-4 mr-2" />
+                 GitHub
+               </Button>
+             </div>

+                 <span className="bg-white px-2 text-gray-500">Or continue with</span>
+               </div>
+             </div>

+                   <Mail className="absolute left-3 top-3 h-4 w-4 text-gray-400" />
+                   <Input
+                     id="email"
+                     type="email"
+                     placeholder="Enter your email"
+                     value={formData.email}
+                     onChange={(e) => handleInputChange('email', e.target.value)}
+                     className="pl-10"
+                     required
+                   />
+                 </div>
+               </div>
+

+                 <Label htmlFor="password">Password</Label>

+                   <Lock className="absolute left-3 top-3 h-4 w-4 text-gray-400" />
+                   <Input
+                     id="password"
+                     type={showPassword ? 'text' : 'password'}
+                     placeholder="Enter your password"
+                     value={formData.password}
+                     onChange={(e) => handleInputChange('password', e.target.value)}
+                     className="pl-10 pr-10"
+                     required
+                   />
+                   <button
+                     type="button"
+                     onClick={() => setShowPassword(!showPassword)}

+                   className="text-sm text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-700 hover:underline"

+                   Forgot password?
+                 </Link>
+               </div>
+ 
+               <Button
+                 type="submit"
+                 className="w-full bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700"
+                 disabled={isLoading}
+               >
+                 {isLoading ? (
+                   <div className="flex items-center">
+                     <div className="animate-spin rounded-full h-4 w-4 border-b-2 border-white mr-2"></div>
+                     Signing in...
+                   </div>
+                 ) : (
+                   'Sign in'
+                 )}
+               </Button>
+             </form>
+ 
+             <div className="text-center">
+               <p className="text-sm text-gray-600">
+                 Don't have an account?{' '}
+                 <Link
+                   to="/register"
+                   className="text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-700 hover:underline font-medium"
+                 >
+                   Sign up
+                 </Link>
+               </p>
+             </div>
+           </CardContent>
+         </Card>
+ 
+         {/* Footer */}
+         <div className="text-center mt-8">
+           <p className="text-xs text-gray-500">
+             By signing in, you agree to our{' '}
+             <Link to="/terms" className="hover:underline">
+               Terms of Service
+             </Link>{' '}
+             and{' '}
+             <Link to="/privacy" className="hover:underline">
+               Privacy Policy
+             </Link>
+           </p>
+         </div>
+       </div>
+     </div>
+   );
+ };
```

- Responsive design
- Accessibility features (proper labels, alt text)

---

Perfect! I've fixed the routing issue. The problem was that the `/*` wildcard route was catching all routes, including `/login`. Now I've restructured it so that:

1. **`/login`** - Shows only the login page without any sidebar
2. **All other routes** (`/`, `/schedule`, `/staff`, `/reports`, `/settings`, `/user`) - Show the full app layout with sidebar

The key changes:
- Removed the nested routing structure that was causing the issue
- Made each main app route explicit and individual
- Each main app route now properly wraps its component with the `SidebarProvider` and sidebar layout
- The `/login` route remains standalone without any sidebar components

Now when you navigate to `/login`, you'll see only the clean login page without the sidebar, and all other routes will show the full app with the sidebar as expected.

---

_**Assistant**_

I'll implement role-based access control with two dummy users (admin and normal user). Let me create an authentication context and update the components accordingly.

---

```diff
- 
+ import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect } from 'react';
+ 
+ export interface User {
+   id: string;
+   email: string;
+   name: string;
+   role: 'admin' | 'user';
+ }
+ 
+ interface AuthContextType {
+   user: User | null;
+   login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<boolean>;
+   logout: () => void;
+   isAuthenticated: boolean;
+   isAdmin: boolean;
+ }
+ 
+ const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType | undefined>(undefined);
+ 
+ // Dummy users for demonstration
+ const DUMMY_USERS: User[] = [
+   {
+     id: '1',
+     email: 'admin@shiftly.com',
+     name: 'Admin User',
+     role: 'admin',
+   },
+   {
+     id: '2',
+     email: 'user@shiftly.com',
+     name: 'John Doe',
+     role: 'user',
+   },
+ ];
+ 
+ // Dummy credentials
+ const DUMMY_CREDENTIALS = [
+   { email: 'admin@shiftly.com', password: 'admin123' },
+   { email: 'user@shiftly.com', password: 'user123' },
+ ];
+ 
+ export const AuthProvider: React.FC<{ children: React.ReactNode }> = ({
+   children,
+ }) => {
+   const [user, setUser] = useState<User | null>(null);
+ 
+   // Check for existing session on mount
+   useEffect(() => {
+     const savedUser = localStorage.getItem('shiftly_user');
+     if (savedUser) {
+       try {
+         setUser(JSON.parse(savedUser));
+       } catch (error) {
+         localStorage.removeItem('shiftly_user');
+       }
+     }
+   }, []);
+ 
+   const login = async (email: string, password: string): Promise<boolean> => {
+     // Simulate API call delay
+     await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
+ 
+     // Check credentials
+     const credential = DUMMY_CREDENTIALS.find(
+       (cred) => cred.email === email && cred.password === password
+     );
+ 
+     if (credential) {
+       const userData = DUMMY_USERS.find((u) => u.email === email);
+       if (userData) {
+         setUser(userData);
+         localStorage.setItem('shiftly_user', JSON.stringify(userData));
+         return true;
+       }
+     }
+ 
+     return false;
+   };
+ 
+   const logout = () => {
+     setUser(null);
+     localStorage.removeItem('shiftly_user');
+   };
+ 
+   const isAuthenticated = !!user;
+   const isAdmin = user?.role === 'admin';
+ 
+   return (
+     <AuthContext.Provider
+       value={{
+         user,
+         login,
+         logout,
+         isAuthenticated,
+         isAdmin,
+       }}
+     >
+       {children}
+     </AuthContext.Provider>
+   );
+ };
+ 
+ export const useAuth = () => {
+   const context = useContext(AuthContext);
+   if (context === undefined) {
+     throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider');
+   }
+   return context;
+ }; 
```

```diff
- function App() {
+ // Protected Route Component
+ const ProtectedRoute: React.FC<{ children: React.ReactNode }> = ({ children }) => {
+   const { isAuthenticated } = useAuth();
+   
+   if (!isAuthenticated) {
+     return <Navigate to="/login" replace />;

+   }
```

Perfect! I've successfully implemented role-based access control with the following features:

## 🔐 **Role-Based Authentication System**

### **Dummy Users Created:**
1. **Admin User:**
   - Email: `admin@shiftly.com`
   - Password: `admin123`
   - Role: `admin`

2. **Regular User:**
   - Email: `user@shiftly.com`
   - Password: `user123`
   - Role: `user`

### **Key Features Implemented:**

#### **1. Authentication Context (`AuthContext.tsx`)**
- Manages user authentication state
- Handles login/logout functionality
- Stores user session in localStorage
- Provides role-based access helpers

#### **2. Updated Login Page**
- Real authentication with dummy credentials
- Shows demo credentials for easy testing
- Error handling for invalid credentials
- Automatic redirection after successful login

#### **3. Role-Based Sidebar Navigation**
- **Admin users see:** Dashboard, Schedule, Staff, Reports, Settings, User Profile
- **Regular users see:** Only User Profile
- Shows current user info and logout button

#### **4. Route Protection**
- **`ProtectedRoute`:** Requires authentication
- **`AdminRoute`:** Requires admin role
- Automatic redirection to login for unauthenticated users
- Regular users redirected to User Profile if trying to access admin routes

#### **5. Role-Based Dashboard**
- **Admin Dashboard:** Full staff schedule overview with today's schedule and upcoming shifts
- **Regular User Dashboard:** Shows welcome message and User Profile page

### **How It Works:**
1. **Admin Login:** Access to all features and full dashboard
2. **User Login:** Only access to User Profile page
3. **Automatic Redirects:** 
   - Unauthenticated → Login page
   - Regular user trying admin routes → User Profile
4. **Persistent Sessions:** Login state maintained across browser refreshes

The system now provides complete role-based access control where admins have full system access while regular users are restricted to only their profile management!

---

Perfect! I've successfully added a logout confirmation modal to the AppSidebar component. Here's what I implemented:

## 🔐 **Logout Confirmation Modal Features:**

### **Key Changes Made:**

1. **Added Required Imports:**
   - `useState` from React for modal state management
   - Dialog components (`Dialog`, `DialogContent`, `DialogDescription`, etc.)
   - `Button` component for the modal actions

2. **State Management:**
   - Added `isLogoutModalOpen` state to control modal visibility

3. **Updated Event Handlers:**
   - `handleLogoutClick()`: Opens the confirmation modal
   - `confirmLogout()`: Performs the actual logout and closes modal
   - `cancelLogout()`: Closes the modal without logging out

4. **Modal Implementation:**
   - **Title:** "Confirm Logout"
   - **Description:** Clear explanation of what will happen
   - **Actions:** 
     - **Cancel Button:** Dismisses the modal (outline style)
     - **Logout Button:** Confirms logout (destructive/red style with logout icon)

### **User Experience:**
- **Click Logout** → Modal appears asking for confirmation
- **Click Cancel** → Modal closes, user stays logged in
- **Click Logout (in modal)** → User is logged out and redirected to login page
- **Click outside modal or press Escape** → Modal closes (default Dialog behavior)

The modal follows the same design system as the rest of the application with proper styling, spacing, and visual hierarchy. Users now have a safety net to prevent accidental logouts!

now when i click on any sidebar after login it is logging me out, it should not happen it should take me to that page

_**Assistant**_

I see the issue! The problem is that the sidebar navigation items are using regular `<a>` tags with `href` attributes, which cause full page refreshes and lose the authentication state. Let me fix this by using React Router's `Link` component instead.

---

```diff
  } from 'lucide-react';
  import { useState } from 'react';
+ import { Link, useLocation } from 'react-router-dom';
  
  import {
```

```diff
    const { user, logout, isAdmin } = useAuth();
    const navigate = useNavigate();
+   const location = useLocation();
    const [isLogoutModalOpen, setIsLogoutModalOpen] = useState(false);
  
```

```diff
                  {navigationItems.map((item) => (
                    <SidebarMenuItem key={item.title}>
-                     <SidebarMenuButton asChild>
-                       <a href={item.url}>
+                     <SidebarMenuButton asChild isActive={location.pathname === item.url}>

                          <item.icon />

-                       </a>
+                       </Link>
                      </SidebarMenuButton>
                    </SidebarMenuItem>
```

---

Perfect! I've fixed the navigation issue by making the following key changes:

## 🔧 **Navigation Fix Applied:**

### **Root Cause:**
The sidebar was using regular HTML `<a>` tags with `href` attributes, which caused full page refreshes. This would reload the entire application and lose the authentication state stored in React context.

### **Solution Implemented:**

1. **Added React Router Imports:**
   - `Link` for client-side navigation
   - `useLocation` to track current route for active state

2. **Replaced `<a>` tags with `<Link>` components:**
   - Changed `<a href={item.url}>` to `<Link to={item.url}>`
   - This enables client-side navigation without page refreshes

3. **Added Active State Indication:**
   - Added `isActive={location.pathname === item.url}` to highlight the current page
   - This provides visual feedback for which page the user is currently on

### **Benefits:**
- ✅ **No more accidental logouts** when clicking sidebar items
- ✅ **Faster navigation** (no page refreshes)
- ✅ **Preserved authentication state** across navigation
- ✅ **Active page highlighting** for better UX
- ✅ **Proper React Router integration**

Now when you click on any sidebar item, it will smoothly navigate to that page while maintaining your login session and showing which page is currently active!

## Reports Page Features:
- **Statistics Cards**: Display key metrics like total staff, active shifts, pending requests, and overtime hours
- **Report Generation**: Dropdown to select report types (Staff Schedule, Overtime Report, Department Summary) with date range selection
- **Weekly Schedule Overview**: Table showing staff allocation across departments and days
- **Export Functionality**: Button to download generated reports
- **Responsive Design**: Grid layout that adapts to different screen sizes

## Settings Page Features:
- **General Settings**: Hospital name, timezone, and default shift duration configuration
- **Notification Settings**: Toggle switches for email notifications, SMS alerts, shift reminders, and overtime alerts
- **Security Settings**: Password update form with validation
- **Department Management**: List of departments with edit functionality and ability to add new departments
- **Data Management**: Export, import, and clear data options with confirmation dialog
- **Consistent Design**: Uses shadcn components throughout for a cohesive look

Both pages now follow the same design system as the rest of the application, using:
- **Card components** for organized sections
- **Proper typography** with consistent headings and descriptions
- **Form controls** (Input, Select, Label) for user interactions
- **Buttons** with appropriate variants and icons
- **Responsive layouts** that work on different screen sizes
- **State management** for interactive elements

The pages are fully functional with proper event handlers and state management, ready for integration with a backend API when needed. The design maintains consistency with the existing application while providing comprehensive functionality for both reporting and settings management.

Perfect! I've successfully made the Dashboard component responsive. Here's a summary of the responsive improvements I implemented:

## 🎯 Dashboard Responsive Features:

### **1. Adaptive Layout System**
- **Mobile-first approach** with responsive padding (`p-4 sm:p-6`)
- **Flexible spacing** that adjusts based on screen size (`space-y-6 sm:space-y-8`)
- **Responsive margins** for better mobile experience (`mb-6 sm:mb-8`)

### **2. Dual Display System**
- **Desktop Table View** (`hidden md:block`): Full table layout for larger screens
- **Mobile Card View** (`md:hidden`): Card-based layout for mobile devices
- **Smooth transitions** between layouts at the `md` breakpoint (768px)

### **3. Mobile-Optimized Cards**
- **Compact design** with proper spacing and visual hierarchy
- **Avatar sizing** optimized for mobile (`h-10 w-10` vs `h-8 w-8` in table)
- **Truncated text** to prevent overflow on small screens
- **Status badges** positioned for easy scanning
- **Shift information** displayed in a highlighted box for better readability

### **4. Enhanced Table Design**
- **Improved typography** with better contrast and font weights
- **Hover effects** for better interactivity (`hover:bg-gray-50`)
- **Proper table structure** with semantic HTML
- **Horizontal scrolling** support for very wide content
- **Better spacing** and visual separation

### **5. Responsive Typography**
- **Scalable headings** (`text-2xl sm:text-3xl` for main title)
- **Adaptive font sizes** for different screen sizes
- **Improved color contrast** for better accessibility

### **6. Loading State Improvements**
- **Responsive skeleton loading** that adapts to screen size
- **Consistent spacing** during loading states

### **7. Mobile-Specific Optimizations**
- **Touch-friendly** card interfaces
- **Proper spacing** for finger navigation
- **Optimized information density** for small screens
- **Flex layouts** that prevent content overflow

## 📱 Breakpoint Behavior:
- **Mobile (< 768px)**: Card-based layout with stacked information
- **Tablet & Desktop (≥ 768px)**: Traditional table layout with enhanced styling

The Dashboard now provides an excellent user experience across all device sizes, with the mobile card view making it easy to scan staff information on phones, while the desktop table view maintains the detailed overview that administrators need on larger screens.

---

Perfect! I've fixed the mobile sidebar background color issue. Here's a summary of the changes I made:

## 🔧 Mobile Sidebar Background Fix:

### **1. Updated Sidebar Component (`src/components/ui/sidebar.tsx`)**
- **Added `!important` modifier** to the `bg-sidebar` class: `!bg-sidebar` to ensure it overrides the default `bg-background` from `SheetContent`
- **Added explicit background** to the inner container: `bg-sidebar` class on the flex container to ensure complete coverage

### **2. Cleaned Up CSS (`src/index.css`)**
- **Removed duplicate sidebar CSS properties** that were causing conflicts
- **Added specific mobile sidebar styling** with `[data-mobile="true"]` selector and `!important` declaration
- **Streamlined the CSS structure** for better maintainability

## 🎯 What This Fixes:

### **Before:**
- Mobile sidebar had transparent/white background due to `SheetContent`'s default `bg-background` class taking precedence
- Inconsistent styling between desktop and mobile sidebar

### **After:**
- **Consistent background color** across desktop and mobile
- **Proper sidebar theming** that respects light/dark mode
- **Robust styling** that won't be overridden by other components

## 📱 Mobile Sidebar Features:
- **Proper background color** matching the desktop sidebar
- **Responsive design** that adapts to screen size
- **Theme support** for both light and dark modes
- **Smooth animations** when opening/closing
- **Touch-friendly** interface for mobile devices

The mobile sidebar will now have the correct background color (`--sidebar` CSS custom property) and will maintain consistency with the desktop version while providing an optimal mobile experience.

```diff

+ import * as React from 'react';
+ import * as TabsPrimitive from '@radix-ui/react-tabs';
+ 
+ import { cn } from '../../lib/utils';
+ 
+ const Tabs = TabsPrimitive.Root;
+ 
+ const TabsList = React.forwardRef<
+   React.ElementRef<typeof TabsPrimitive.List>,
+   React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof TabsPrimitive.List>
+ >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <TabsPrimitive.List
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn(
+       'inline-flex h-10 items-center justify-center rounded-md bg-muted p-1 text-muted-foreground',
+       className
+     )}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ TabsList.displayName = TabsPrimitive.List.displayName;
+ 
+ const TabsTrigger = React.forwardRef<
+   React.ElementRef<typeof TabsPrimitive.Trigger>,
+   React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof TabsPrimitive.Trigger>
+ >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <TabsPrimitive.Trigger
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn(
+       'inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap rounded-sm px-3 py-1.5 text-sm font-medium ring-offset-background transition-all focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=active]:bg-background data-[state=active]:text-foreground data-[state=active]:shadow-sm',
+       className
+     )}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ TabsTrigger.displayName = TabsPrimitive.Trigger.displayName;
+ 
+ const TabsContent = React.forwardRef<
+   React.ElementRef<typeof TabsPrimitive.Content>,
+   React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof TabsPrimitive.Content>
+ >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
+   <TabsPrimitive.Content
+     ref={ref}
+     className={cn(
+       'mt-2 ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2',
+       className
+     )}
+     {...props}
+   />
+ ));
+ TabsContent.displayName = TabsPrimitive.Content.displayName;
+ 
+ export { Tabs, TabsList, TabsTrigger, TabsContent };
```

Perfect! I've successfully implemented an enhanced Schedule page with modern design and comprehensive functionality. Here's what I've created:

## 🗓️ Enhanced Schedule Management System

### **Key Features Implemented:**

#### **1. Modern UI Design**
- **Clean, professional layout** with proper spacing and typography
- **Responsive design** that works on desktop, tablet, and mobile
- **Consistent shadcn component usage** throughout the interface
- **Modern color scheme** with proper contrast and accessibility

#### **2. Comprehensive Dashboard**
- **Statistics Cards** showing:
  - Total shifts this week
  - Today's scheduled shifts  
  - Available staff members
  - Pending requests requiring approval
- **Real-time data** with dynamic calculations

#### **3. Advanced Shift Management**
- **Enhanced shift table** with proper filtering and search
- **Color-coded shift types** for easy visual identification:
  - Morning Shift (Blue)
  - Day Shift (Green) 
  - Evening Shift (Orange)
  - Night Shift (Purple)
  - Extended Day (Teal)
  - Extended Night (Indigo)
- **Status tracking** (Scheduled, Completed, Cancelled)
- **Smart search** across staff names, departments, and roles

#### **4. Intelligent Filtering System**
- **Search functionality** with real-time filtering
- **Department filter** dropdown
- **Status filter** for shift states
- **Combined filtering** for precise results

#### **5. Staff Management**
- **Smart staff selection** with autocomplete search
- **Auto-populated fields** when selecting staff members
- **Department and role validation**
- **Comprehensive staff database**

#### **6. Request Management System**
- **Tabbed interface** for pending vs. all requests
- **One-click approval/rejection** for pending requests
- **Visual status indicators** with icons:
  - ⚠️ Pending (Yellow)
  - ✅ Approved (Green)
  - ❌ Rejected (Red)
- **Request type categorization** (Change, Swap, Time-off)

#### **7. Weekly Overview Sidebar**
- **7-day calendar view** with shift counts
- **Completion tracking** for each day
- **Visual progress indicators**
- **Quick date navigation**

#### **8. Enhanced Form Experience**
- **Modal-based shift creation** with proper validation
- **Staff search with dropdown suggestions**
- **Auto-completion** of department and role fields
- **Date picker** for scheduling
- **Visual shift type selection** with color indicators

#### **9. Data Management**
- **State management** for all components
- **Real-time updates** when creating/modifying shifts
- **Persistent data** throughout the session
- **Proper error handling**

### **Technical Implementation:**

#### **Components Used:**
- ✅ **Table** - Professional data display
- ✅ **Tabs** - Request management interface  
- ✅ **Cards** - Statistics and information display
- ✅ **Dialog** - Modal forms
- ✅ **Select** - Dropdown menus
- ✅ **Input** - Form fields and search

#### **Features:**
- 📊 **Real-time statistics** calculation
- 🔍 **Advanced search and filtering**
- 📅 **Weekly calendar overview**
- 👥 **Staff request management**
- 🎨 **Color-coded shift types**
- 📱 **Fully responsive design**
- ⚡ **Fast, efficient rendering**
- 🔄 **State synchronization**

The Schedule page now provides a comprehensive, professional-grade shift management system that hospital administrators can use to efficiently manage staff schedules, approve requests, and maintain optimal staffing levels across all departments.

```diff
+ const getStatusColor = (status: string) => {
+   switch (status) {
+     case 'Active':
+       return 'bg-green-100 text-green-800';
+     case 'On Leave':
+       return 'bg-yellow-100 text-yellow-800';
+     case 'Inactive':
+       return 'bg-red-100 text-red-800';
+     default:
+       return 'bg-gray-100 text-gray-800';
    }
  };
```

```diff
+                           onClick={() => handleDelete(staff.id)}
+                         >
+                           <Trash2 className='h-4 w-4' />
+                         </Button>
+                       </div>
+                     </TableCell>
+                   </TableRow>
+                 ))}
+               </TableBody>
+             </Table>
+           </div>
+ 
+           {filteredStaff.length === 0 && (
+             <div className='text-center py-8'>
+               <Users className='h-12 w-12 text-muted-foreground mx-auto mb-4' />
+               <h3 className='text-lg font-semibold mb-2'>No staff members found</h3>
+               <p className='text-muted-foreground mb-4'>
+                 {searchTerm || selectedDepartment !== 'all' || selectedStatus !== 'all'
+                   ? 'Try adjusting your search or filter criteria.'
+                   : 'Get started by adding your first staff member.'}
+               </p>
+               {!(searchTerm || selectedDepartment !== 'all' || selectedStatus !== 'all') && (
+                 <Button onClick={handleAddNew}>
+                   <Plus className='h-4 w-4 mr-2' />
+                   Add First Staff Member
+                 </Button>
+               )}
+             </div>
+           )}
          </CardContent>
        </Card>
```

Perfect! The Staff page has been successfully enhanced with mobile-friendly and responsive design. Here's a summary of the improvements I've made:

## 🎯 **Mobile-First Responsive Staff Management**

### **Key Mobile Enhancements:**

1. **📱 Responsive Layout**
   - Adaptive padding: `p-4 md:p-6` for mobile/desktop
   - Flexible header with stacked layout on mobile
   - Grid adjustments: `grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-4` for stats cards

2. **🔍 Enhanced Search & Filters**
   - Full-width search bar on mobile with search icon
   - Stacked filter layout: `flex-col sm:flex-row`
   - Added status filter for better staff management
   - Responsive filter widths: `w-full sm:w-[160px]`

3. **📋 Dual View System**
   - **Mobile Card View**: Clean cards with avatars, contact info, and dropdown actions
   - **Desktop Table View**: Traditional table layout for larger screens
   - Automatic switching using CSS classes: `block md:hidden` / `hidden md:block`

4. **💳 Mobile Staff Cards**
   - Compact design with staff photos
   - Truncated text to prevent overflow
   - Contact information with icons (email/phone)
   - Dropdown menu for actions (Edit/Delete)

5. **📊 Responsive Statistics**
   - 2-column layout on mobile, 4-column on desktop
   - Simplified card titles for mobile viewing
   - Dynamic filtering indicators

6. **🎨 Enhanced Modal**
   - Mobile-optimized form layout
   - Stacked labels on mobile: `grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-4`
   - Full-width buttons on mobile: `w-full sm:w-auto`
   - Proper margins: `mx-4` for mobile spacing

7. **🎯 Improved UX Features**
   - Empty state with helpful messaging
   - Loading skeletons for both mobile cards and desktop table
   - Better status badges with custom colors
   - Dropdown actions for space-efficient mobile interactions

### **Technical Improvements:**

- **Added Components**: DropdownMenu, enhanced icons (Mail, Phone, Search, Filter)
- **Better State Management**: Added status filtering, removed unused variables
- **Responsive Design**: CSS-based responsive switching instead of JavaScript
- **Enhanced Data**: Added more staff members and roles for better testing
- **Improved Accessibility**: Better touch targets, proper contrast, semantic HTML

### **Mobile Features:**
- ✅ Touch-friendly interface
- ✅ Optimized for small screens
- ✅ Fast loading with skeletons
- ✅ Intuitive navigation
- ✅ Efficient use of screen space
- ✅ Accessible design patterns

The Staff page now provides an excellent mobile experience while maintaining full desktop functionality. Users can easily manage staff members, search and filter efficiently, and perform all CRUD operations seamlessly across all device sizes! 📱💼

## ✅ **Mobile-Friendly Leave Requests Section - COMPLETED!**

I've successfully fixed the mobile responsiveness issues in the Leave Requests section of the User page. Here's a summary of the improvements made:

### **🎯 Key Mobile Enhancements:**

1. **📱 Responsive Header Layout**
   - Changed from `flex justify-between items-center` to `flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:justify-between sm:items-center gap-4`
   - This ensures the title and button stack vertically on mobile instead of being cramped horizontally

2. **🔘 Full-Width Apply Leave Button**
   - Added `w-full sm:w-auto` classes to make the button full-width on mobile
   - Provides better touch targets and visual hierarchy on small screens

3. **📝 Enhanced Dialog Form**
   - **Date Inputs**: Changed from `grid-cols-2` to `grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2` so date fields stack on mobile
   - **Dialog Container**: Added `mx-4` for proper mobile margins
   - **Dialog Footer**: Added responsive classes `flex-col sm:flex-row gap-2` for button stacking
   - **Form Buttons**: Made Cancel and Submit buttons full-width on mobile with `w-full sm:w-auto`

4. **⚡ Improved Action Buttons**
   - **Leave Request Cards**: Enhanced Edit/Cancel buttons to stack vertically on mobile
   - **Responsive Layout**: `flex flex-col sm:flex-row gap-2 w-full sm:w-auto`
   - **Better Spacing**: Removed problematic `ml-4` on mobile, kept it for desktop with `sm:ml-4`

### **📱 Mobile Experience Now Includes:**
- ✅ **Proper button stacking** - No more cramped horizontal layouts
- ✅ **Full-width touch targets** - Easier to tap on mobile devices
- ✅ **Responsive form fields** - Date inputs stack nicely on small screens
- ✅ **Optimized spacing** - Better use of screen real estate
- ✅ **Consistent button sizing** - Full-width on mobile, auto-width on desktop
- ✅ **Improved visual hierarchy** - Clear separation between elements

### **🎨 Technical Improvements:**
- **Responsive Grid System**: Proper use of Tailwind's responsive prefixes
- **Flexible Layouts**: Smart use of flexbox for different screen sizes
- **Touch-Friendly Design**: Larger touch targets and better spacing
- **Clean Code**: Removed unused imports and maintained code quality

The Leave Requests section now provides an excellent mobile experience while maintaining full desktop functionality. Users can easily apply for leave, edit pending requests, and manage their leave applications seamlessly across all device sizes! 📱✨

Perfect! I've successfully made the logo bigger on mobile screens. Here's what I changed:

## ✅ **Enhanced Mobile Logo Display**

### **📱 Mobile Improvements:**

1. **🔍 Larger Logo on Mobile**
   - **Mobile**: `h-10 w-10` (40px × 40px) - 25% larger than before
   - **Desktop**: `sm:h-8 sm:w-8` (32px × 32px) - maintains original desktop size
   - Better visibility and brand presence on smaller screens

2. **📝 Enhanced Text Sizing**
   - **Mobile**: `text-base` (16px) for "HCL" text - more readable
   - **Desktop**: `sm:text-sm` (14px) - maintains compact desktop layout
   - Better typography hierarchy across devices

### **🎨 Visual Benefits:**
- ✅ **Better Brand Visibility** - Logo is more prominent on mobile home screen
- ✅ **Improved Touch Targets** - Larger logo area for better mobile interaction
- ✅ **Responsive Design** - Automatically adjusts between mobile and desktop
- ✅ **Professional Appearance** - Maintains clean, modern look across all devices
- ✅ **Better Readability** - Text is more legible on mobile screens

### **📐 Size Comparison:**
- **Before**: 32px × 32px on all screens
- **After**: 
  - Mobile: 40px × 40px (25% larger)
  - Desktop: 32px × 32px (unchanged)

The logo now has a stronger presence on mobile devices while maintaining the clean, professional look on desktop screens. This creates better brand recognition and improves the overall mobile user experience! 📱✨
